Apple___Apple_scab.symptoms: Olive-green or brown spots on leaves, lesions on fruit.
Apple___Apple_scab.causes: Fungal infection caused by Venturia inaequalis.
Apple___Apple_scab.preventive_measures: Prune and destroy affected leaves, apply fungicide before symptoms appear.

Apple___Black_rot.symptoms: Dark, sunken lesions on fruit and cankers on branches.
Apple___Black_rot.causes: Fungal infection caused by Botryosphaeria obtusa.
Apple___Black_rot.preventive_measures: Prune infected branches, avoid fruit injuries.
Apple___Black_rot.treatment: Use copper or sulfur sprays during dormant season.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.symptoms: Bright yellow-orange spots on leaves, twig dieback.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.causes: Fungal disease involving cedar trees as an alternate host.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.preventive_measures: Remove nearby cedar trees, apply fungicide early in the season.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.treatment: Fungicide sprays like myclobutanil or propiconazole.

Apple___healthy.preventive_measures: Maintain proper pruning and nutrient management.

Blueberry___healthy.preventive_measures: Proper irrigation and balanced soil nutrition.

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.symptoms: White powdery coating on leaves and shoots.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.causes: Fungal disease caused by Podosphaera clandestina.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.preventive_measures: Prune for air circulation, avoid overhead watering.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.treatment: Use sulfur-based fungicide or horticultural oils.

Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.preventive_measures: Maintain proper tree care and watering schedule.

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.causes: Fungal infection caused by Cercospora zeae-maydis.

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.causes: Fungal infection caused by Puccinia sorghi.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.preventive_measures: Plant rust-resistant varieties, avoid overhead irrigation.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.treatment: Use foliar fungicides if rust is widespread.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.causes: Fungal infection caused by Setosphaeria turcica.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.treatment: Apply foliar fungicides during early symptoms.

Corn_(maize)___healthy.preventive_measures: Ensure good agricultural practices like crop rotation.

Grape___Black_rot.symptoms: Small, brown circular spots on leaves, fruit mummification.
Grape___Black_rot.causes: Fungal infection caused by Guignardia bidwellii.
Grape___Black_rot.preventive_measures: Prune infected areas, ensure proper air circulation.
Grape___Black_rot.treatment: Apply fungicide sprays like mancozeb or myclobutanil.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).symptoms: Striped leaves with black fruit spots.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).treatment: No effective treatment, focus on prevention.

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.causes: Fungal disease caused by Isariopsis spp.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.preventive_measures: Prune to increase airflow, avoid waterlogged soils.

Grape___healthy.preventive_measures: Regular pruning and proper vineyard care.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).causes: Bacterial disease spread by psyllid insects.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).preventive_measures: Control psyllids, use disease-free planting material.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).treatment: No cure available, remove infected trees.

Peach___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small, dark lesions on leaves and fruit.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.causes: Bacterial infection caused by Xanthomonas arboricola.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.preventive_measures: Use resistant varieties, avoid overhead watering.

Peach___healthy.preventive_measures: Regular pruning and good orchard management.

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Water-soaked lesions on leaves and fruit.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.causes: Bacterial infection caused by Xanthomonas campestris.

Potato___Early_blight.symptoms: Dark spots on lower leaves with concentric rings.
Potato___Early_blight.causes: Fungal infection caused by Alternaria solani.

Potato___Late_blight.symptoms: Water-soaked lesions on leaves and stems, white mildew.
Potato___Late_blight.causes: Fungal infection caused by Phytophthora infestans.
Potato___Late_blight.preventive_measures: Use resistant varieties, avoid wet foliage.

Potato___healthy.preventive_measures: Maintain proper nutrient management and crop rotation.

Raspberry___healthy.preventive_measures: Ensure proper drainage and balanced soil nutrition.

Soybean___healthy.preventive_measures: Rotate crops and maintain soil fertility.

Squash___Powdery_mildew.symptoms: White powdery patches on leaves and stems.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.causes: Fungal infection caused by Erysiphe cichoracearum.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.preventive_measures: Ensure good air circulation and avoid overhead watering.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.treatment: Apply fungicides like sulfur or potassium bicarbonate.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.symptoms: Red or purple spots on leaves, leading to leaf scorch.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.causes: Fungal infection caused by Diplocarpon earlianum.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.preventive_measures: Avoid overhead irrigation, remove infected leaves.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.treatment: Use fungicides like myclobutanil or captan.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Dark water-soaked spots on leaves and fruits.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.causes: Bacterial infection caused by Xanthomonas vesicatoria.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.preventive_measures: Use resistant varieties, avoid overhead watering.

Tomato___Early_blight.symptoms: Concentric rings on leaves, fruits, and stems.
Tomato___Early_blight.causes: Fungal infection caused by Alternaria solani.
Tomato___Early_blight.treatment: Use fungicides like chlorothalonil or copper.

Tomato___Late_blight.symptoms: Water-soaked lesions on leaves, stems, and fruits.
Tomato___Late_blight.causes: Fungal infection caused by Phytophthora infestans.
Tomato___Late_blight.preventive_measures: Use resistant varieties, avoid wet foliage.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.symptoms: Yellow spots on upper leaf surfaces with mold underneath.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.causes: Fungal infection caused by Passalora fulva.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.preventive_measures: Increase air circulation and avoid leaf wetness.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.treatment: Apply fungicides like mancozeb or copper.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.symptoms: Small, circular spots with gray centers and dark edges.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.causes: Fungal infection caused by Septoria lycopersici.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.preventive_measures: Prune infected leaves, avoid overhead watering.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.treatment: Apply fungicides like mancozeb or chlorothalonil.

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.symptoms: Tiny, yellowing spots and webbing on leaves.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.preventive_measures: Maintain proper irrigation and humidity levels.

Tomato___Target_Spot.symptoms: Brown, concentric lesions on leaves and fruit.
Tomato___Target_Spot.causes: Fungal infection caused by Corynespora cassiicola.
Tomato___Target_Spot.preventive_measures: Use resistant varieties, avoid overcrowding plants.
Tomato___Target_Spot.treatment: Apply fungicides like mancozeb or copper.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.symptoms: Yellowing and upward curling of leaves.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.treatment: No cure, focus on vector control.

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.symptoms: Mottled, yellow-green leaves with blistered texture.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.causes: Viral infection spread through contaminated tools.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.preventive_measures: Disinfect tools, avoid handling plants when wet.
